IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To advance organ availability and transplantation by uniting and supporting our communities for the benefit of patients through education, technology, and policy development.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To advance organ availability and transplantation by uniting and supporting our communities for the benefit of patients through education, technology, and policy development.
IRS990.Description: Administer the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network (OPTN) which performs the matching and facilitates the distribution of donated human organs with potential recipients. A computer database is maintained at UNOS that includes the relevant medical information of all individuals in the nation who are listed for a transplant. As organs become available, the database is used to match the organs with the best potential recipient. A onetime fee of $557 is charged to list a registrant in the database. As of 09/30/2010 there were approximately 108,872 registrants on the waiting list. During fiscal year 2010, approximately 28,676 patients were transplanted.

Activity2.Description: Data Analysis, including providing member services (which increase the efficiency and accuracy of data collection and analysis, and facilitating consensus building for UNOS Policy development), promoting organ and tissue donation, and privately funded professional education projects.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: Contact with legislators was conducted by staff and an outside firm in order to encourage laws that benefit the general public as it relates to organ donation.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: During 2010, the Organization adopted FASB guidance related to accounting for uncertainty in income taxes, which clarifies the accounting for income taxes prescribing the minimum recognition threshold that a tax position is required to meet before being recognized in the Organization's financial statements. The interpretation also provides guidance on derecognition, classification, interest and penalties, disclosure and transition.
Consolidated UNOS Foundation Revenue ($282,074) Satisfaction of Program Restrictions ($49,380)
Restricted Donations ($45,045) Gain on Disposal of Property (11,122)

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Compensation and W-2's for Donate Life America (a separate, non related organization) staff are issued by UNOS. This includes Donate Life America President and CEO G. David Fleming, a highly compensated employee. These expenses are included in the audited financial statements and IRS 990 for Donate Life America, however, to match W-2 information to the proper issuing company; Mr. Fleming is reported with UNOS officers and directors.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: IRS Form 990 is made available to UNOS Finance Committee members prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Officers, Directors and Key employees are required to sign a conflict of interest statement. Each individual is required to notify the company should a conflict arise in the course of their tenure.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Executive compensation is determined by a compensation committee comprised of specific directors as well as the three prior chairs of the Board of Directors. An outside agency is used to determine the comparable salaries in the industry and local area.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: UNOS policies and bylaws, as well as IRS form 990 are available on the corporate website or by request.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.Explanation: Extensions were filed and approved by the IRS extending the due date to August 15, 2011
